children.markdown:
Victor Tsemo from the [West Midlands Centre for Constructing Excellence podcasts](www.wmcce.org) is up next, talking about, well, podcasts. ([They’re available on iTunes](http://itunes.apple.com/WebObjects/MZStore.woa/wa/viewPodcast?id=316447294))
Not a huge amount here that’s specific to the built environment. It’s more of a set of general podcasting tips:
- plan - keep it short (15 to 25 mins) - Have a major name interview subject - Not too frequent (once or twice a month) - The chair is very important, because she must manage the guests
Some discussion on Twitter about Victor’s suggestion that podcasting is expensive. Many people’s experience is absolutely counter to that – you can produce good results cheaply and simply. But here’s his recipe for doing it:
[Construction Talk Podcast: How We Do (overview)](http://vimeo.com/6011670) from [victor](http://vimeo.com/user2127208) on [Vimeo](http://vimeo.com).
